thread.title: Knockerball Orlando Helping Schools, Churches, and Charities Fundraise $300-$800 an Hour
thread.title_full: Knockerball Orlando Helping Schools, Churches, and Charities Fundraise $300-$800 an Hour - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8

author: cbs8
title: Knockerball Orlando Helping Schools, Churches, and Charities Fundraise $300-$800 an Hour
text:
A popular knockerball game company is now helping local schools, churches, and charities raise money to help further their cause.
Winter Park, FL (PRWEB) October 08, 2015
The lifeline of any non-profit organization, school, or charity is having the funds to carry out their message in changing the lives of individuals across the globe, and thanks to a new fundraising opportunity Knockerball Orlando is offering, raising money can not only be profitable, but also fun.
Knockerball Orlando Owner Jason Thomas, who was featured in the latest edition of The Orlando Business Journal, said its Orlando fundraising options can generate a surprising level of funds with minimal effort on your part.
“We can bring the excitement to your Orlando fundraising event all you need is the people,” Thomas stressed, before adding, “Our Bubble Soccer team will bring all of the necessary equipment to facilitate playing all of our games (typically 10 players at a time). We will also manage the game play experience and when it’s all said and done, we’ll pack up and take it home.”
Knockerball Orlando is an independent business licensed through Boca Raton-based Knockerball USA LP, an international brand and the largest supplier of Knockerballs with more than 180 knockerball-affiliated businesses using the brand and product.
“Knockerball isn’t just bubble soccer though,” Thomas stressed, before adding, “We play several different games like, sharks and minnows, King of the Hill, Last Man Standing, Red Rover and our favorite Knockerbrawl.”
In just one hour, according to Thomas, the company can usually accommodate between 60 and 80 players, and depending on the event that can translate to $300 to $800 an hour in funds generated for an Orlando fundraising event.
The Orlando Fundraising Packages include: 10 Knockerballs, all the necessary equipment for any of the company’s games and a referee to manage all of the gameplay.
“The only thing that’s needed from you to make sure that your event is a success is a volunteer to collect money should you decide to charge per person for people to play,” Thomas noted. “To get more details on how Knockerball Orlando can aid with your fundraising efforts give us a call at 407-252-2611.”
As to what makes Knockerball Orlando different from everything else on the market, Thomas pointed out that his company uses only genuine Knockerball products.
“Knockerball is the biggest and best name in the bubble soccer industry,” Thomas noted. “Other companies are often times just ordering cheap equipment off of some foreign trade site. Was any quality control ever done? It definitely was at Knockerball.”
For more information, please visit: http://www.knockerballorlando.com/orlando-fundraising-events/
About Knockerball Orlando
Knockerball Orlando is a company that provides a game in which people inside inflatable spheres collide with their coworkers and bosses while playing soccer, football or red rover as a team-building exercise.
Source: Knockerball Orlando LLC
 //www.prweb.com/releases/2015/10/prweb13011812.htm
